review_title: Best example of work life balance I've seen in a company
pros:
-4 day work where you're actually encouraged to take Fridays off

-Friendly & encouraging company culture that actually roots for your success

-Big one: Leadership team actually listens to feedback from employees and uses that feedback to help inform decisions

-Actually embodies the mission
cons: -Fast-paced working environment. While this keeps things interesting, it also makes prioritizing difficult as deadlines seem to be moved up regularly

review_title: One of the best but always room for improvement.
pros: Benefits, work-life balance, mission, co-workers
cons: A bit slow to make decisions and execute. Not everything should be a consensus.

pros: Location, industry, that’s about it

review_title: Respect, Teamwork, Do the right thing

review_title: Wonderful place to work, great mission, great people
job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Boise, ID
pros: Healthwise is a model company. They treat their employees well, deliver great evidence based content and are a force for good in the world. The software teams are above average in terms of skill, ambition, and team cohesiveness.
cons: As other reviews state, after the founder left, Healthwise found itself a bit lost. But all appears well again under the direction of the new CEO (and longtime Healthwiser). In many ways, Healthwise is a victim of their own success - locked in to formats and APIs which seem impossible to change now that they are widely in use. But efforts are underway and I think the future looks bright for them.

review_title: Nice culture, but not very open to change
pros: Smart, nice people. Flexible workplace. Mission-driven.
cons: Very tightly managed, too much consensus, hard to make real change or take risks.

pros: Great mission - a company doing good in the world. Smart people - collaborating on bringing new products and accessible content to the world. Culture - a nice culture with an emphasis on health and dogs in the work place.
cons: Lacks diversity - the organization could improve if the staff better reflected the people they serve in the world.

pros: Great mission, very laid back and great work life balance
cons: Slow to innovate in the health market

review_title:
Healthwise: 
Healthwise: A nonprofit company with a good ear for business
pros: Healthwise has a great mission (to help people make better health decisions). It tries very hard to follow through on its corporate culture of respect, teamwork, and doing the right thing. It doesn't always succeed, but the fact that it cares about such things (as well as conducting 2 employee satisfaction surveys per year) puts it ahead of most other companies. The benefits are good, although unusual: Healthwise provides a high-deductible medical and pharmacy benefits plan but contributes to each employee's account annually to help them meet the deductible. While at times overly earnest and a bit too particpatory when it comes to decision making, the upside of that is that most of the business is pretty transparent. The company was named one of 10 best small workplaces by the Wall Street Journal in 2007.
cons: Possibly the biggest missteps come in the way of employee managment and human resources. Or it may just seem that way because of the high standards the company sets for itself (respect, teamwork, and do the right thing). When it stumbles, it stumbles hard. The company has grown more than 30% for each of the past 3 years, and it is having a difficult time hanging onto its culture. Even still, it's a small company, with just over 200 employees. Some of the company policies reflect a Ma & Pa mentality that can be kind of maddening to anyone who has worked for a larger or more corporate organization.

job_title: Product Marketing Manager in Boise, ID
pros: Work-life balance, benefits, and culture are second to none. They care about you as a person first, employee second. The work is interesting and meaningful. Can’t recommend enough!
cons: Sometimes disorganized, slow to change

review_title: Nonprofit heart with for profit function.
job_title: Senior Solutions Consultant in Boise, ID
pros: Strong community and comradery. Smart people. Dogs in the workplace. Good salaries in many departments (not all). Strong mission.
cons: Slow to change. Male dominated, top down culture in multiple departments. Little promotional/growth opportunity.

pros: Healthwise is a wonderful company to be associated with.  They truly care about the welfare of employees and always tries to do the right thing.  Employees are intelligent, collaborative and focused on our mission.  It is fulfilling to work for a company that is mission-driven with a mission to help all consumers be empowered to manage their healthcare .  We have very good products and are in the process of designing and creating products that promise to have significant impact in the market and further our mission.   I do not take my job for granted and appreciate the company, our people and what we do.
cons: We have been guilty of being slow in making decisions and taking a bit too conservative stance regarding business risks.  HW has recognized these problems and are putting new resources and revised processes in place to resolve them.

pros: Healthwise is an exceptional place to work.  The people are so friendly, intelligent and welcoming.  I have worked for some really fun and amazing companies, but none of them compare to Healthwise.  If I would have known what it is was like be a part of Healthwise earlier in my career I would have made the switch a long time ago.  And on top of all of that the mission of helping people make better health decisions rocks.
cons: Changes over the past 3 years or so have led to some confusion about the company culture.  This has upset some long-time employees.  However, Healthwise is by far the best company I have ever worked for.  A lot of these people eventually find their way back to Healthwise.

pros: Great people - individual contributors are talented, engaged, and passionate about their work.
cons:
Lack of trust between teams and between employees and management.
Lack of employee development - most managers have never received training on leadership or management, so there is a lack of consistency in how managers communicate with their employees, their expectations on performance, goal setting, etc.    
Employee development is minimal to non existent.  As a result, skills do not keep up with the changing dynamics of the industry, job roles, etc.  
Work-live balance, or lack thereof.

pros: Addressing an important need in healthcare: educating and engaging the consumer to be an accountable patient. Good evidence based content. High customer satisfaction with services. Technology that integrates this content into other health IT systems. New president is a positive step.
cons: Lack of product management success. It's a really hard job especially in the current environment which is essentially a hung jury. There isn't anything new to get excited about. Many have concerns about the limited growth of the company over the last several years.

review_title: Mission driven nonprofit with outstanding culture and work environment
pros: Bright, creative and motivated workforce passionate about helping people make better health decisions. Excellent work environment and culture - respect, teamwork, and do-the-right thing are the guiding principles. New operational CEO is shaking things up a bit to move us forward for future growth.
cons: I honestly can't think of anything to say here. The organization is going through quite a bit of change right now...some are struggling with that. For me, I think it is absolutely the right thing for the company.

review_title: Ups and downs like most companies
pros: I can bring my dog with me to work. Great people, great mission, focus on wellness and interesting problems to solve. Flexible schedules, health saving contributions, healthy snacks.
cons: Not the best work-life balance at times. Some teams seem overloaded with few changes. Compensation isn't the best, but the company is a non-profit, which should be expected. The work planning process is nuts.

pros:
Great people
Dedicated to mission
Mission to help people make better health decisions -- and its really true
cons:
Bad benefits.  Benefits designed for the young and healthy.
Not great salaries, but guess its to be expected at a small non-profit.

review_title: Great but challenging in the area of work-life balance
pros: Great people, location and culture.  Good development opportunities.  Respectful environment based on solid cultural pillars.  Changing paradigms in Healthcare contribute to a market that's in transition which makes it both fun and challenging/stimulating.
cons: Organizational changes are contributing to very heavy workloads.  Difficult to onboard quickly due to product, technology, market, etc.. complexities.  resource constrained.

pros: Great culture, good working environment, fun place to work, good mission. They do a twice-yearly employee satisfaction survey, which is nice. You can bring your dog to work.
cons: Salaries aren't really up to what they should be, but it is a not-for-profit. Depending on which team you're on in the organization, there's not a lot of potential for growth.

pros: A great place to work--I have never worked with people who have such diverse interests and talents.   Awesome location near open space in Boise.  A  mission to help people make better health decisions--something I feel good helping to support.
cons: Some adjustments during the time that company founder retired and current CEO was named--company culture that Healthwise was known for is rebounding.

review_title: I feel lucky to work here
pros: Mission-oriented company. Good workplace culture. Dogs at work. Leadership that walks its talk. Really smart colleagues. Healthy!
cons: Too much work, not enough time. Too many meetings some days.

pros: Good work env and co mission.  Somewhat flexible work env. Nice offices and reasonably good benefits.  Feel good about working for a non profit...
cons: New CEO is changing a lot of things.  Limited financial resources for R & D.  Lack of Product leadership.  Process heavy environment.

pros: Flexible hours, people who really care about their work

pros: Great people to work with.  Very nice people.
cons: Management does not listen to employees.  The company did not want to hear different ideas.  Very narrow minded.
